revision.text:
{{Wired embedded system |brand=UMAX (MaxGate) |model=UGate-Plus |revision=v2 |upc= |ean= |asin=B00004W41A;US; |price= |est_release_date=11/1999 |fcc_date= |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |manuf=SerComm |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=router |fcc_id= |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=0.8 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=AMD |cpu1_model=Am186EM-40KC;Am186EM-40KC, AMD, Am186(tm)EM-40KC, F 9941MGM, (m) (C) AMD 94, (C) INTEL '78 '82; |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu1_cores= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |cpu2_cores= |fla1=512 KiB |fla1_brand=AMD |fla1_model=Am29F400BT-70EC |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=512 KiB |ram1_brand=EliteMT |ram1_model=LP621024CS-12 |ram1_num=4 |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |eth_none= |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand=Davicom |eth_chip1_model=DM9008F;DM9008F, 9936-BB, F6M54; |eth_chip2_brand=Davicom |eth_chip2_model=DM9102F;DM9102F, 9923S, M5G31; |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=PCI/ISA Bridge Controller;Eureka Microelectronics;EK10A002;EK10A002, SC001/58200001;1; |flags= |stock_boot= |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui_eth=00:C0:02 }} {{TagLine|'''UGate-Plus''' : the easiest solution for power SOHO users}}
{{ProductPage|http://web.archive.org/web/20010208083959/http://www.maxgate.net/products/ugateplus.html}} (via archive.org) A '''SerComm''' board P/N ("4900C500B") is silkscreened on one particular unit's board. Additionally, a date code of '''9947''' is etched onto the back of the board. :From the date code on this board, it's presumed to be the v2 unit. A label affixed to the bottom of the board reads "C500F4 1.1". [http://www.practicallynetworked.com/review.asp?pid=308 ''thiggins'' review of the device on '''Practically Networked'''] (dated 1999-04-01) :[http://www.practicallynetworked.com/item.asp?pid=308 and the spec page on '''PN'''] This device has a 10Mbit WAN port and 100Mbit LAN port. ==Additional external links== *[http://www.ccplace.com/mr_pics/colinc/ugatescreenb.jpg Review on '''CCPlace'''] *[http://cablemodeminfo.com/umaxreview2.html-ssi ''Enter below to win a UMAX Ugate!'' @ '''CableModemInfo.com'''] :The screenshot notes the MAC as starting with '''00:C0:02''' ('''SerComm'''). ==Images== File:UMAX_UGate+_v2_unit_top.jpg|top File:UMAX_UGate+_v2_unit_bottom.jpg|bottom + label File:UMAX_UGate+_v2_unit_ports.jpg|ports File:UMAX_UGate+_v2_unit_DIP.jpg|DIP switch {{#set:Has images=external|Has images=label}} File:UMAX_UGate+_v2_board_top.jpg|board top File:UMAX_UGate+_v2_board_bot.jpg|board bottom File:UMAX_UGate+_v2_board_bot_CL1.jpg|board bottom, closeup File:UMAX_UGate+_v2_DM9008F.jpg|DM9008F File:UMAX_UGate+_v2_DM9102F.jpg|DM9102F {{#set:Has images=internal}}
